name: Engineering Mechanics
description: This course introduces the principles of engineering mechanics. Students will learn about vector mechanics, particle dynamics, rigid body dynamics, deformation and strain, stress, and energy.

name: Statics
description: This course introduces the principles of statics. Students will learn about the equilibrium of particles and rigid bodies under different loading conditions.

name: Dynamics
description: This course introduces the principles of dynamics. Students will learn about the motion of particles and rigid bodies under different loading and constraint conditions.

name: Mechanics of Materials
description: This course introduces the principles of mechanics of materials. Students will learn about the deformation and stress analysis of materials under different loading conditions.

name: Introduction to Geotechnical Engineering
description: This course introduces the principles of geotechnical engineering. Students will learn about soil mechanics, rock mechanics, and foundation engineering.

name: Geology for Engineers
description: This course introduces the principles of geology. Students will learn about the classification, formation, and properties of rocks and soil.

name: Soil Mechanics
description: This course introduces the principles of soil mechanics. Students will learn about soil properties, soil classification, soil compaction, and soil stabilization.

name: Foundation Engineering
description: This course introduces the principles of foundation engineering. Students will learn about shallow and deep foundation design, bearing capacity, settlement, and slope stability.

name: Rock Mechanics
description: This course introduces the principles of rock mechanics. Students will learn about rock properties, rock classification, rock drilling, and rock slope stability.

name: Tunneling
description: This course introduces the principles of tunneling. Students will learn about tunnel types, tunnel construction methods, and tunnel design.
